Description: Intact imported pottery aryballos made of pale cream fabric, decorated on the exterior with two horizontal stripes of red paint. The same colour also occurs on the rim. There is a small pierced handle beneath the rim. The base of flat. The exterior bears patches of incrustation, probably gypsum.
Curator's comments: A second Aryballos in this style was found at Tell Dafana (EA 23714 - to be published by J. Spencer). Compare the striped decoration with with other East Greek vessels painted in different places: Cook-Dupont 1998, 132-4. Compare also with a striped-aryballos from Selinunt: Dehl-von Kaenel 1995, 374 n.3593 pl. 66 (S. Weber)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64 § 61, pl. xxxv, 49)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 289)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.95, fig.15, p.108, p.195, pl.37)
